info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 5:27PM EDT until June 08 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR EASTERN UNION COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA...SOUTHERN PREBLE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO... At 526 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Liberty, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Liberty, Camden, West College Corner, Salem, College Corner, Somerville, West Elkton, Whitewater State Park, Charlottesville, Fairhaven, Hueston Woods State Park, Goodwins Corner, Billingsville, Collinsville, Cottage Grove, Clifton, Morning Sun, Wheatville and Kitchel. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
